Neznanci napadli ljubljanski klub Tiffany
01 Nov 2019, 16:19 by STA

Skupina ljudi je danes zjutraj napadla LGBT-klub Tiffany na Metelkovi v Ljubljani. Napadalci so razbili vhodna vrata in okna ter grozili osebju kluba, ob prihodu policistov pa so pobegnili, je klub zapisal na facebooku. Nastalo je za nekaj tisoč evrov škode, so pojasnili na PU Ljubljana, ki morebitne očividce naproša za dodatne informacije.




LJUBLJANA > Napadalci so danes zjutraj po zaprtju kluba razbili vhodna vrata stavbe Lovci, v kateri sta LGBT-kluba Tiffany in Monokel, in vdrli v klub. Kot je razvidno iz fotografije, ki jo je na svoji strani na facebooku objavil klub Tiffany, so poškodovali tudi hodnike.
Osebje kluba se je pred nasilneži zateklo v notranje prostore in zabarikadiralo vrata. Napadalci so hoteli priti do njih, razbijali po hodniku in vratih, jih zmerjali in jim grozili.
Napadalci pobegnili ob prihodu policistov
Osebje je močno pretreseno, a k sreči nihče ni bil poškodovan, so zapisali v klubu. Policija je bila o napadu nemudoma obveščena, ob prihodu policistov pa so napadalci pobegnili.
Kot so pojasnili na Policijski upravi (PU) Ljubljana, policisti preiskujejo sum storitve kaznivega dejanja javnega spodbujanja sovraštva, nasilja ali nestrpnosti in zbirajo obvestila za izsleditev trenutno še neznanih storilcev.
Vse, ki bi o dogodku lahko kaj vedeli, zato pozivajo, da se zglasijo na Policijsko postajo Ljubljana Center oziroma pokličejo na 113 ali na anonimni telefon policije 080 1200.
Nocoj bodo organizirali dogodek Tukaj smo
V Društvu ŠKUC nasilni dogodek odločno obsojajo in pristojne organe pozivajo, da ukrepajo proti nasilnežem v skladu z zakonom. “Izredno zaskrbljeni smo, ker s homofobijo motivirano nasilje in kazniva dejanja naraščajo. Samo v zadnjem mesecu smo bila priča dvema nasilnima napadoma na LGBT-osebe v Sloveniji. Vsako nasilje, sovražno dejanje na osnovi spolne usmerjenosti ali spolne identitete, spodbujanje in širjenje sovraštva do LGBT-manjšin je treba takoj ustaviti,” so pozvali.
Nocoj bodo v Klubu Monokel zato organizirali dogodek pod geslom Tukaj smo, s katerim bodo opozorili, da ne gredo nikamor in se ne bodo pustili ustrahovati. K solidarnostni akciji upora proti nasilju in ustrahovanju pozivajo vse člane in zaveznike skupnosti LGBT.
Šarec: Napad na Tiffany je strahopetno, bedno dejanje
Napad so obsodili tudi društvo Legebitra, zagovornik načela enakosti in predsednik vlade Marjan Šarec. “Napad na klub Tiffany v Ljubljani je strahopetno, bedno dejanje. Žal tovrstno nasilje ni osamljen primer v naši družbi. Prepričan sem, da bodo pristojni organi opravili svoje delo in izsledili storilce,” je na twitterju zapisal Šarec.
“Razloge za ponovno porast homofobnega, bifobnega in transfobnega nasilja gre iskati tudi v dopuščanju, da je izražanje sovraštva postalo del družbene in politične kulture,” so zapisali v društvu Legebitra. Pozivajo k doslednemu obravnavanju verbalnega, psihičnega, fizičnega in drugega nasilja, še posebej, če je storjeno na podlagi manjšinskih osebnih okoliščin.
Tudi zagovornik načela enakosti Miha Lobnik je v odzivu opomnil, da moramo imeti kot družba odklonilno stališče do vsakršnega nasilja, ki je usmerjeno proti manjšinam. Po njegovi oceni lahko napad na klub Tiffany, ki je eden redkih odkritih in vidnih prostorov skupnosti LGBT, razumemo kot napad na celotno skupnost LGBT.
Iz Generalne policijske uprave so dodatno sporočili, da se v policiji zavedajo problematike kaznivih ravnanj na škodo določenih družbenih skupin, med drugim tudi na škodo istospolno usmerjenih. “Zato smo v preteklih letih izvedli vrsto aktivnosti skupaj z nevladnimi organizacijami LGBT skupnosti, ki so bile namenjene izobraževanju, usposabljanju in osveščanju policistov,” so zapisali.Dodali so, da se policisti redno udeležujejo forumov, posvetov in strokovnih srečanj nevladnih organizacij in združenj, na katerih so prisotni predstavniki LGBT. Pred organiziranjem njihovih prireditev policisti sodelujejo z organizatorji, kjer usklajujejo in izmenjujejo podatke o morebitnih grožnjah.“Z aktivnostmi bomo nadaljevali, pred kratkim smo bili tudi obveščeni, da smo uspeli pridobiti EU sredstva za skupni projekt, v katerem sodelujemo z društvom Legebitra in katerega namen je vzpostavljanje in krepitev zaupanja in sodelovanja med LGBT skupnostjo in policijo,” so napovedali.“V policiji zagovarjamo ničelno toleranco do nasilnih dejanj in enako obravnavo vseh oseb v policijskih postopkih, saj je prepoved diskriminacije v policijskem delu absolutna. Tovrstna kazniva ravnanja pa obravnavamo prednostno,” so dodali.

Strangers attack the Tiffany club in Ljubljana
01 Nov 2019, 15:19 by STA

A group of people raided the Tiffany LGBT Club in Metelkova, Ljubljana this morning. The attackers smashed front doors and windows and threatened the club's staff and fled when officers arrived, the club wrote on facebook. The damage amounted to several thousand euros, they explained to the Ljubljana Police Department, which asks potential eyewitnesses for additional information.




LJUBLJANA> This morning, after the club closed, the attackers broke the front door of the Hunters building, which houses Tiffany and Monokel's LGBT clubs, and broke into the club. As shown in a photo posted by the Tiffany club on his facebook page, the hallways were also damaged.
In front of the bullies, the club's staff took refuge in the interior and barricaded the door. The attackers wanted to get to them, smashing down the hall and the door, taunting and threatening them.
The attackers fled on the arrival of the officers
The staff was severely shaken but thankfully no one was injured, the club wrote. The police were immediately notified of the attack, and on the arrival of the officers, the attackers fled.
According to the Ljubljana Police Directorate, police investigate suspicion of committing a crime of public incitement to hatred, violence or intolerance and collect notices to track down the perpetrators who are currently unknown.
Anyone who might know anything about the event is asked to call the Ljubljana Center Police Station or call 113 or the police's anonymous telephone number 080 1200.
Tonight they will organize an event We are here
The ŠKUC Society strongly condemns the violent event and calls on the competent authorities to take action against the abusers in accordance with the law. "We are extremely concerned that homophobia-motivated violence and crime are on the rise. Just last month we witnessed two violent attacks on LGBT people in Slovenia. Any violence, hostile act based on sexual orientation or gender identity, inciting and spreading hatred of LGBT minorities must be stopped immediately, ”they urged.
So tonight they will be organizing an event under the motto here at Monokel Club, here they will be warned not to go anywhere and not to be intimidated. All members and allies of the LGBT community are calling for solidarity action against the violence and intimidation.
Shariq: Attacking Tiffany is a cowardly, miserable act
The attack was also condemned by the Legebitra Society, an advocate of the principle of equality and Prime Minister Marjan Sarac. “Attacking the Tiffany Club in Ljubljana is a cowardly, miserable act. Unfortunately, this kind of violence is not an isolated case in our society. I am convinced that the competent authorities will do their work and track down the perpetrators, ”wrote Šarec on twitter.
"Reasons for the rise in homophobic, biphobic and transphobic violence also lie in allowing hatred to become part of the social and political culture," the Legebitra Society wrote. They call for a consistent treatment of verbal, psychological, physical and other violence, especially if it is done on the basis of minority personal circumstances.
Miha Lobnik, an advocate of the principle of equality, reminded in his response that as a society we must have a negative attitude towards any violence directed at minorities. In his estimation, the attack on the Tiffany Club, one of the few open and visible spaces of the LGBT community, can be seen as an attack on the entire LGBT community.
The General Police Directorate further reported that the police are aware of the problem of criminal acts to the detriment of certain social groups, including the harm of same-sex oriented ones. "That's why over the years, we have conducted a series of activities with LGBT community NGOs aimed at educating, training and raising awareness among police officers," they wrote. They added that police officers regularly attend forums, consultations and professional meetings of NGOs and associations, attended by LGBT representatives. Before organizing their events, police officers work with the organizers to coordinate and exchange information about potential threats. is about building and building trust and cooperation between the LGBT community and the police, "they announced." We advocate zero tolerance of acts of violence in the police and equal treatment of all persons in police procedures, since the prohibition of discrimination in police work is absolute. But we treat these kinds of crimes as a priority, ”they added.
